meanings.sent1: Using a ramp can enable people in wheelchairs to access buildings easily.
meanings.sent2: Studying hard can enable you to pass your exams with good grades.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand could enable the cat to speak English for a day.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude can enable her to climb the mountain of challenges ahead.
meanings.sent5: Regular exercise can enable you to feel strong and healthy.

meanings.definition: To give someone the authority or means to do something
meanings.sent1: The manager will enable the team to make important decisions on their own.
meanings.sent2: The key will enable you to unlock the door and enter the room.
meanings.sent3: The fairy godmother will enable Cinderella to attend the royal ball.
meanings.sent4: Education can enable individuals to open doors to new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's guidance will enable the apprentice to learn new skills effectively.
